original: Lagerfelt, Gustaf Axel Emanuel, friherre, generalmajor, Linköping, f. 25/8/77 i Kärna, östergötl. 1., av kab:-kammarh., frih. Gustaf L. o. Hedvig Loven. G. 23 m. hovfröken Stina von Stockenström, RJubGM, Finsk-MGM. Barn Margareta f. 24, Christina 27. — Mogiex. 95. Under-löjtn. v. Första Svea art:reg. 97, löjtn. 03, kapt. 11, major v. gen:staben 18, v. Norrl. art:reg. 20, v. Posit :art :reg. 21, öv:löjtn. i armén 23, överste 26, gen :major i gen:tetet 36. Repetitör v. AIHS 02-04, lär. där 09-15, art:stab5-off. 06-09, ch. f. AIHS 22-30, ch. f. Bodens art:reg. o. art:befälh. i Bodens fästn. 30, tf. kommend. i Bodens fästn. 33-35, kommend. 35-37. Skr.: Minnesskr. v. art:stabens lOO-årsdag (11), Lärob. i art. I-H (16 o. 17). Medarb. i Art:tidskr. 23-30. KSOlkl, KVOlkl, RCXHLsO, RNO, ProPatr-stGM, KDD02gr, KFlnlVRO, RFrHL, LKrVA.
translated:
Lagerfelt, Gustaf Axel Emanuel, Baron, Major General, Linköping, b. 25/8/77 in Kärna, östergötl. 1st, son of Cabinet Chamberlain Gustaf L. and Hedvig Loven. Married on 23 m. (19xx) to Maid of Honor Stina von Stockenström, a member of the Royal Jubilee Gold Medal and the Finnish Military Medal. They have two children, Margareta born in 24 and Christina in 27. 

Military career:
Enlisted as Second Lieutenant in the First Svea Artillery Regiment in 97, promoted to Lieutenant in 03, Captain in 11, Major in the General Staff in 18, served in the Norrland Artillery Regiment in 20, in the Posit Artillery Regiment in 21, promoted to Lieutenant Colonel in the army in 23, Colonel in 26, and Major General in 36.

Educational and professional background:
Served as a tutor at AIHS (Artillery Institution for Higher Studies) from 02 to 04, as a teacher there from 09 to 15, and as a staff officer in the Artillery Staff 5 from 06 to 09. Chief of AIHS from 22 to 30, chief of Boden Artillery Regiment and commanding officer of Boden Fortress in 30. Acting commander of Boden Fortress from 33 to 35, and commander from 35 to 37. 

Written works:
Authored a commemorative speech for the 100th anniversary of the Artillery Staff in 11, as well as textbooks on artillery I-H in 16 and 17. Collaborated with the Artillery Magazine from 23 to 30.

Honors and awards:
Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Knight of the Order of Vasa, Royal Swedish Military Order of the Cross of Honour, Order of the Sword, Pro Patria Gold Medal, Commander 2nd Class of the Royal Order of the Dog and the Lion, Commander 1st Class of the Finnish White Rose, Royal Freemason Honor League, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences.
